perturbation.original_text: ADAMS GOLF must exercise its right of termination within ninety (90) days of its senior management becoming aware of the conduct giving rise to the right of termination.
perturbation.changed_text: ADAMS GOLF must exercise its right of termination within thirty (30) days of its senior management becoming aware of the conduct giving rise to the right of termination.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the termination window to 30 days from 90 could be deemed unreasonably short depending on the circumstances and jurisdiction, potentially conflicting with principles of fairness and reasonable notice implicit in contract law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied Covenant of Good Faith and Fair Dealing
perturbation.law_explanation: The implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing requires parties to act honestly and reasonably in the performance and enforcement of contracts. A 30-day window for termination after becoming aware of misconduct may be deemed insufficient in some jurisdictions depending on the complexity of the issue and the required investigation, potentially violating this covenant.

perturbation.original_text: Payment shall be made to ADAMS GOLF within one month following the end of the calendar year. For example, if in the calendar year 2005 CONSULTANT achieves a satisfactory record of play in [*****] events, he shall repay ADAMS GOLF [*****] dollars no later than January 31, 2006.
perturbation.changed_text: Payment shall be made to ADAMS GOLF within two weeks following the end of the calendar year. For example, if in the calendar year 2005 CONSULTANT achieves a satisfactory record of play in [*****] events, he shall repay ADAMS GOLF [*****] dollars no later than January 14, 2006.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the payment window to two weeks might violate state wage laws if repayment is considered a deduction from potential earnings and the shortened period does not allow sufficient time for accurate calculation and processing.
perturbation.law_explanation: The Kansas Wage Payment Act dictates how and when employees (or consultants in this case if considered analogous) must be paid. While this specifically refers to final payments upon termination, broadly reducing the payment timeframe for any compensation-related repayment to only two weeks may present practical problems for ADAMS GOLF to compute the amount, therefore increasing the risk of violations related to proper and timely payment of compensation.

perturbation.original_text: CONSULTANT disapproves, the reasons therefore shall be given to ADAMS GOLF in writing within three (3) business days or shall be deemed approved.
perturbation.changed_text: CONSULTANT disapproves, the reasons therefore shall be given to ADAMS GOLF in writing within one (1) business day or shall be deemed approved.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the approval timeframe to one business day may not provide sufficient time for the consultant to adequately review advertising material, especially complex campaigns, and could violate the implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied Covenant of Good Faith and Fair Dealing
perturbation.law_explanation: The implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing requires both parties to act reasonably. Reducing the review period to only one business day for advertising approval may be viewed as unreasonable and not providing adequate time for a thoughtful response, potentially conflicting with the requirement of good faith.
